result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason J. Bastien was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.dispoDesc: 12 mos. DJA on Ct #1, not commit any criminal offenses during the period of this agreement, notify the FdL Cty. DA's Office anc Clerk of Court's Office of any change of address within 48 hours of said change, notify the Coordinator of police contacts or changes of phone number, comply with all terms of diversion supervision including reporting to Diversion Coordinator on the 1st Wednesday of eachn month, pay diversion supervision fees of $25/mo. to the DA's office, make reasonable attempts to locate and/or maintain full-time employment or education, not possess and/or consumer alcohol and/or controlled substances, attend and successfully complete an AODA within 90 days of signing this agreement, submit to UA screening when requested to do so, attend AA or an appropriate equivalent agroup's meetings no less than once per month, undergo a Domestic Violence evaluation at St. Agnes Hospital or a preapproved alternative within 90 days of signing this agreement as well as complete any recommended follow through counseling/treatment.

supervisions.notes:
Huber with out of county travel for employment, work search, and treatment at the discretion of jail administration.

FDL County Jail indicates there is no sentence credit in this matter.
5/19/17 DOC 101 filed extending Probation for 1 year; new discharge date of 7/1/18

miscConds.notes: If probation is discharged/revoked with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due and/or other collection procedures will be implemented.

Absolute Sobriety.

Not to be in any bars or taverns.

Not to possess or consume alcohol.

Not to be in any bars or taverns.

No violent contact with victim

Participate in AODA and Domestic Violence treatment.

To pay supervision fees as determined by the DOC.

Continue with AA or similar meetings

DNA Surcharge but no sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
